intro: Galium sylvestre var. hirtellum, commonly known as hairy woodrinse, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems that often form dense mats. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and covered with fine, hairy glands, giving it a distinctive texture. Galium sylvestre var. hirtellum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
